Based on the provided preferences, I would recommend watching "A Bridge Too Far" (1,974) directed by Robert Redford and based on a screenplay by William Goldman. This movie is set during World War II and follows the story of two British soldiers who are sent to destroy a bridge in Nazi-occupied France. As they make their way through France, they encounter various obstacles and challenges, including war, terrorism, political instability, economic crisis, natural disasters, environmental degradation, pollution, deforestation, animal rights abuse, human rights abuses, genocide, ethnic cleansing, and other forms of violence against humanity.
The movie "A Bridge Too Far" directed by Robert Redford is an excellent choice for someone who enjoys watching movies set during World War II. This movie features a great cast including William Goldman (screenplay), Robert Redford (director), Donald Sutherland (producer), Richard Burton (actor), and many more talented actors.
The movie "A Bridge Too Far" directed by Robert Redford is also known for its excellent storyline, well-developed characters, and engaging plot.
